meanings.definition: To tie or fasten together with a knot.
meanings.sent1: I will interknot the two ropes to make a strong bond.
meanings.sent2: She always interknots her shoelaces to prevent them from coming undone.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to interknot the scarves, but they ended up in a tangled mess.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to interknot our hearts, creating an unbreakable connection.
meanings.sent5: The spider skillfully interknotted its web, creating a beautiful pattern.

meanings.definition: A knot or tangle in a cord or rope.
meanings.sent1: I struggled to untangle the interknot in the fishing line.
meanings.sent2: The sailor deftly undid the interknot in the ship's rigging.
meanings.sent3: The interknot in the garden hose made watering the plants a challenge.
meanings.sent4: The interknot in her hair was so tight, it took hours to comb out.
meanings.sent5: The interknot in the necklace symbolized the unbreakable bond between friends.
